edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class World2D

java.lang.Object
  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.World2D

public abstract class World2D
extends java.lang.Object

The World2D is, along with the Model and Cell classes, the main scientific part of the COMETS program. It handles most of the simulation events, schedules running each of the Models, constructs and deletes new and dead Cells, writes log file outputs, and so on.

Many of these functions should be unique to the extending classes designed for different packages, but there are a number of core functions that all World2D extensions must implement.

Author:
Bill Riehl

Method Detail

backup

public abstract World2D backup()
Makes a copy of this World2D that doesn't share any pointers with the old one.

Returns:
a new World2D

calculateTotalBiomass

public abstract double[] calculateTotalBiomass()
Calculate the total biomass present among all Cells in the World2D.

Returns:
an array of biomasses - one for each Model loaded

changeBiomass

public abstract void changeBiomass(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   double[] biomassDelta)
Changes biomass levels at space (x, y) by some delta value.

Parameters:
x - - the x-coordinate
y - - the y-coordinate
biomassDelta - - the array of values to change biomass by

public abstract int changeMedia(int x,
                                int y,
                                double[] delta)
Changes media levels at space (x, y) by some delta value.

Parameters:
x -
y -
delta -
Returns:
CometsConstants.PARAMS_OK if successful, CometsConstants.PARAMS_ERROR if the delta array is the wrong length, and CometsConstants.BOUNDS_ERROR if the location is out of bounds.

getBiomassAt

public abstract double[] getBiomassAt(int x,
                                      int y)
Returns the biomass at location (x, y).

Parameters:
x - - the x-coordinate
y - - the y-coordinate
Returns:
an array of biomass present at that location, one element for each Model loaded

getAllMedia

public abstract double[][][] getAllMedia()
Returns the entire 3D media matrix that this World2D is currently holding. The first dimension is the columns (x), the second is the rows (y), and the third is the media array at that point.

Returns:
a 3D array of media.

getCellAt

public abstract Cell getCellAt(int x,
                               int y)
Returns the Cell at point (x, y) or null if there's nothing there.

Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:
either a Cell or null

getMediaAt

public abstract double[] getMediaAt(int x,
                                    int y)
Gets the media array at point (x, y). If the coordinate (x, y) is out of bounds, this array will be full of zeros.

Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:
a double array of media components.

getMediaNames

public abstract java.lang.String[] getMediaNames()
Returns:
A String array of names for each nutrient in the media. This will be in the same order at the other various media access methods.
See Also:
getAllMedia(), getMediaAt(int, int)

getNumMedia

public abstract int getNumMedia()
Returns:
the number of nutrient components in the currently loaded media

                                   int y)

Parameters:

y -
Returns:
true if there is a Cell at (x, y).

respawnMedia

public abstract void respawnMedia()
Tells the World2D to respawn the amount of media it knows to respawn, where its supposed to respawn it.

run

public abstract int run()
This is the main thing that the World2D should do - run a simulation. Each time this method is invoked, a run cycle is performed, and a return value appropriate to the model is returned. Often this will be either PARAMS_OK or PARAMS_ERROR.

The details of running a cycle are left to the implementing package.

Returns:
some return value after running.

setBarrier

public abstract int setBarrier(int x,
                               int y,
                               boolean barrier)
This sets the space at (x, y) to either be a barrier or not, according to the barrier variable.

Parameters:
x -
y -
barrier - - true if the space at (x, y) should be a barrier
Returns:
CometsConstants.PARAMS_OK if successful and CometsConstants.BOUNDS_ERROR if the location is out of bounds.

setBiomass

public abstract void setBiomass(int x,
                                int y,
                                double[] biomassDelta)
Sets the biomass value to values given by biomassDelta. Note that this sets the values, it doesn't add or subtract them. If biomassDelta is the wrong length, nothing is done.

Parameters:
x -
y -
biomassDelta -

setMedia

public abstract int setMedia(int x,
                             int y,
                             double[] delta)
Sets the media values at (x, y) to the values in delta. Note that this sets the values, it doesn't add or subtract them.

Parameters:
x -
y -
delta -
Returns:
CometsConstants.PARAMS_OK if successful, CometsConstants.PARAMS_ERROR if the delta array is the wrong length, and CometsConstants.BOUNDS_ERROR if the location is out of bounds.

updateWorld

public abstract int updateWorld()
Updates the world. This should be called whenever something major and structural has been done - resizing the number of rows and columns, or loading or removing a model, for example.

Returns:
PARAMS_OK if everything gets updated okay.

getInfoPanel

public abstract javax.swing.JComponent getInfoPanel(int x,
                                                    int y)
Gets a JComponent with information about the world at point (x, y). Note that this component is stored internally, too. Instead of making multiple calls to getInfoPanel(int, int), it is best to make a single call, then multiple calls to updateInfoPanel(int, int) or updateInfoPanel().

Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:
a JComponent with information of the space at (x, y).
See Also:
updateInfoPanel(), updateInfoPanel(int, int)

updateInfoPanel

public abstract void updateInfoPanel(int x,
                                     int y)
Updates the internal information panel to show information at (x, y). Note that because the actual object is owned by this World2D, any pointer to that panel (e.g., fetched through getInfoPanel(int, int)) will also be updated.

Parameters:
x -
y -

updateInfoPanel

public abstract void updateInfoPanel()
Updates the internal information panel to refresh the information shown at the current point. This should also update any pointers to the information panel.

destroy

public abstract void destroy()
Destroys the current World2D by removing any package-specific necessities. For example, the FBAWorld.destory() kills all running FBARunThreads.
